title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Firefighting and Prevention Workers

content.rendered:
What are Firefighting and Prevention Workers?

Firefighting and Prevention Workers respond to rescue calls and assist people involved in fire or other related accidents.

Where do Firefighting and Prevention Workers work?

  • State government
  • Federal government

How much do Firefighting and Prevention Workers make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Firefighting and Prevention Workers is $54,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Firefighting and Prevention Workers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Public health majors
Search Firefighting and Prevention Worker jobs

Firefighting and Prevention Worker skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Firefighting and Prevention Workers succeed in their work:

  • Ability to stay calm under pressure
  • Great communication skills
  • Physical stamina

What are some common questions about Firefighting and Prevention Workers?

Q: How do I become a firefighter?

A: All firefighters must go through both written and physical tests, complete fire academy training, and have EMT certification.
